case_development.description: Helen Stoner visits Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson early in the morning. She seeks help to investigate her twin sister Julia's mysterious death two years ago. Helen fears her violent stepfather, Dr. Grimsby Roylott.

evidence.description: Detailed account of Julia's death and the strange occurrences in her own room.

case_development.description: Shortly after Helen leaves, Dr. Grimsby Roylott arrives at Holmes' office. He threatens Holmes and Watson, demonstrating his strength by bending a fireplace poker, warning them to stay out of his affairs.

evidence.description: Demonstrates Roylott's violent nature and physical strength.

case_development.description: Holmes and Watson travel to Stoke Moran to investigate. They stop by the registry office to learn about the Stoner family's financial situation and discover that Roylott has a motive to prevent Helen and Julia from marrying.
Holmes and Watson examine Julia’s room, now occupied by Helen. They find a ventilator connecting to Dr. Roylott's room, a bell pull that doesn’t function, and a bed fixed to the floor.

evidence.description: Suggesting the bed's position is crucial for the crime.

case_development.description: Holmes and Watson examine Dr. Roylott’s room. They find a large safe, a saucer of milk, and a leash-like object.

evidence.description: Indicating the presence of an animal.

case_development.description: Holmes and Watson wait in Julia's room at night. They hear a low whistle, and Holmes strikes the bell pull with a cane. A metallic sound follows from Dr. Roylott’s room.

evidence.description: Indicating the snake’s summoning and retrieval.

case_development.description: The snake, enraged by Holmes’ attack, returns to Dr. Roylott and bites him. Roylott dies instantly from the venom.
Holmes explains the case to Watson. He reveals how Dr. Roylott trained the snake to kill Julia and attempted the same with Helen. The motive was to retain control of the inheritance.

evidence.description: Clarifies the method and motive of the crime.

suspects.name: Helen Stoner
suspects.alibi: Present at Holmes' office and later at Stoke Moran.
suspects.motive: Fear of her stepfather and concern over her sister's death.

evidence.description: Describing the strange events and her stepfather’s behavior.

suspects.name: Dr. Grimsby Roylott
suspects.motive: Preventing his stepdaughters from marrying to retain their inheritance.

crime_tricks.method: Dr. Roylott used a venomous snake to kill Julia. The snake was sent through a vent and retrieved using a whistle. The setup in Helen’s room was intended to repeat the crime.
crime_tricks.motive: Roylott aimed to prevent his stepdaughters from marrying to maintain control of their inheritance.

evidence.description: Used to summon the snake back.

culprit.name: Dr. Grimsby Roylott
culprit.motive: Prevent stepdaughters from marrying to retain their inheritance.
